conversion_verification.notes: Second image is rendered from a near/pure top-down view with no clearly visible vertical wall faces; thickness is visible but height/volume and multi-surface wall geometry are not perceptible, triggering automatic rejection (pure top-down orthographic-like view).

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Rejected at Stage 1 (no acceptable angled/isometric 3D presentation and no clearly visible wall height/side faces).

detected_errors.description: No qualifying 3D conversion view: camera is essentially top-down/orthographic-like with insufficient visible wall height and side faces, so interior volume is not convincingly 3D.

summary: The second image is a top-down 2.5D-style render without an angled/isometric perspective and without clearly visible wall height/side faces, so it fails mandatory true-3D verification.
